text: Hi, I am new to using this CRM api (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs-beta/crm/imports>). Is there any other way/api to bulk import CRM data from excel or csv file?
or can someone help me how should i build the `body` part of the POST request? Thanks!
You should setup your files like in here <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/contacts/set-up-your-import-file>
more instructions on how to import: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/contacts/import-objects>
no need to use the api, this is pretty simple if you have a csv file
I don't want to use UI, this will be part of integration automation but thanks
Also check <https://www.import2.com/apps/HubSpot|https://www.import2.com/apps/HubSpot> - a premier partner product for importing and exporting. Also allows automations if you are building integration
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/create_or_update>
I am updating the custom properties of the companies. I think the only solution is the new import endpoint
you mean you are creating the properties for the company OR you are updating a company with custom properties that are already set?
I am updating batch of companies with custom properties that are already set
should just be able to get tocmpany by name/id and update them
```<https://api.hubapi.com/companies/v2/companies/:id?hapikey=#####>```
and the same way with the properties that I pasted early.. shouldn't matter that they are custom properties
yes, this works but i don't think it is as efficient as bulk update/import. by the way thank you for the help and your time
Can you just read a line of a csv and then update the company?
or whatever you are doing
put in a loop
Technically i can, but i think this would be simpler and faster (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs-beta/crm/imports>)
i just don't know how to define body of post request for this endpoint
That just shows you what imports are working
from the ui
if you want to update a group of companies with all similar info you coudl use this api: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/companies/batch-update-companies>
awesome, i think i can use "batch-async" thank you
that might be the best thing for you after hearing what you are trying to accomplish
You can find the deleted pages using filter "deleted_at__gt" 0 while requesting the all pages endpoint.
